info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 2:43PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Beneficial Rains Looking Increasingly Likely Over Northern and Portions of Central Arkansas in the Coming Days... ...Localized Heavy Rainfall Could Occur Over the Next Few Days... Scattered showers and storms will become more likely in the next few days as several systems affect Arkansas. At this time, it appears that the areas most likely to see the most widespread and beneficial rainfall will be over the north and central portions of the state. Over the southern third of Arkansas, rainfall is not expected to be as widespread. However, as a frontal boundary moves into the state and stalls during the next few days, periods of showers and thunderstorms could bring localized heavy rainfall. While the possibility of flash flooding is low due to dry ground caused by deficient rainfall in many areas, the tendency of any storms that form and move over the same areas could be enough to overcome dry ground and cause localized issues. The heaviest rainfall amounts will depend on where the frontal boundary stalls out over the weekend. If the front stalls out closer to southern Arkansas, heavier rainfall amounts would become a better possibility. Please continue to monitor forecasts and statements from your local National Weather Service forecast offices over the next few days for the latest information.
